title: Pictured: manager of Chelsea hair salon killed riding pillion on motorbike | London Evening Standard
text:
She said: “It is just so sad. She was such a generous soul. She was beautiful, kind and caring, a natural comedian too.” 
“She was warm and generous and full of life. 
“Our dad was due to come down to London to spend the weekend for her birthday, they had an incredible weekend planned. 
“Today is particularly difficult for him and us all because it is her birthday. He is absolutely devastated.” 
She said Claire “absolutely loved London” and her job: “She was loved by so many, she had so many friends, We will miss her so much.” 
She was riding pillion when she was thrown from the bike and killed (Nigel Howard) 
Miss Berretti had grown up in Ayr, Scotland, first training as a dancer before a problem with her hip ended her dreams of a career on the stage and working long term as a dance instructor. 
She had taught dance and aerobics in Ayr before coming down to London in her mid 20s. She worked at Richard Ward salon before taking up her job managing the Sejour salon in 2004. She lived in Battersea. 
She was a devoted aunt to her niece and nephew, the children of her only sibling Gillian. She had lost her mother Liz to lung cancer six years ago. 
Sejour, which describes itself as Britain’s premier hair salon, was launched by celebrity hairdresser Shaun Hoffman, who once cut Andy Murray’s hair to raise thousands of pounds for Children in Need. 
A biography on Sejour’s website says: “Claire has been with Sejour since it first opened in June 2004 where with her dedication and expertise within the industry helped in the creating and branding of Sejour. 
“Claire has always been an integral part of the business enabling the salon to run smoothly.” 
Passers-by attempted to resuscitate her in the road but she was pronounced dead at the scene at the junction of Farringdon Road and Clerkenwell Road. 
One has since left a bouquet of flowers, with a note addressed to her family and friends, saying: “Take comfort she did not suffer in pain. 
“Nothing will make this accident any less senseless, but I wanted you to know she didn’t die alone. Many people did everything they could to save her. 
“It was tragic and happened so quickly - but she was surrounded by people who tried and stayed.” 
Former England and Liverpool midfielder Mark Walters was among those who paid tribute to Ms Berretti, who has been photographed with Chelsea FC’s Alex Kiwomya. 
Detectives from the Serious Collision Investigation Unit are investigating.
